column4: hello. What do you suggest about Antivirus for Linux Serer which should protects not only the server but windows clients also?

there is only a handful of linux viruses, and they have been patched ages ago ... they are VERY rare and short-lived ... so you don't need an antivirus protecting the server ... for the windows boxes on the network though, look into ClamAV, it was designed for e-mail scanning, although you can adapt it to almost anything
I'll see. But I tought about nod32 or Kaspersky or Dr. Web.
i'm not sure if corporate antivirus software will work in linux, it's worth some research ... clamav is free, if you are looking for a paid solution, im afraid i'm not much help in that regard
